Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great lobby and great rooms, and the most soothing garden that is really nicely landscaped, staff pleasant, friendly and polite

Reviews.Title: “NIce Place”
Reviews.Author: shenanae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kyoto Grand for a night for an overnight business stay and I would stay there again if I was in the area. It's nothing overly fancy. The staff was helpful, valet parking is available, buffet breakfast, and best of all..... connected to a starbucks. It is right in Little Tokyo so every japanese option of food and market is right there. Also, it was nice to sit in the Garden and hear the running water and see the city from that aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Lush and stylish hotel, just wish it was closer to BH/Hollywood etc”
Reviews.Author: S_K_NG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. My husband and I arrived one night before the rest of my family as we'd done the coastal drive from San Francisco. The bed was so comfy and just what we needed for a good night sleep. We had booked to stay in a deluxe room but it was only when the family arrived (also staying in deluxe room) that we found out our room was standard. We didn't upgrade as we much preferred our room; it was spacious, had a walk in wardrobe, sofa and large bathroom. It also had more of a Japanese feel with the blinds unlike the deluxe, Only difference was it didn't have a 42in TV! It was a corner room so this could explain the extra space so try and request a corner room. The hotel restaurants are expensive and to get to Beverley Hill / Hollywood you either have to drive or get the subway(train) which is about a 5 minute walk and takes about 20 minutes. Our room had a nice view of the garden but the othesrs weren't so lucky. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind the location or paying for parking, if you love Japanese food and want to stay somewhere nice without having to pay the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: calimantra
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to go to LA and found a good price for this hotel. It is located in a clean and safe neighborhood, with many dining options in the nearby little Tokyo. Also, it is within walking distance to downtown, union station and metro station. And so it is a good choice for people who travel without a rental car. The room was clean and comfortable, with a good view of the Japanese gardens. The hotel staff were very friendly and helped us with many things. I recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, Clean, Comfortable & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: CanadianNYCLover
Reviews.Content: The Kyoto Grand was located in the heart of Downtown LA with quick access to everywhere we wanted to go. I was officially traveling with colleagues on business, and the hotel was only a 5 minute drive south to the Fashion District. When we wanted to do some sightseeing, Hollywood was only 5 minutes north of the hotel and Beverly Hills another 5 minutes west of there. We took a drive up into the Hollywood Hills to see the Hollywood sign and it was a very interesting drive - highly recommended if you have a vehicle. The hotel photos of the rooms are 95% accurate, except that our rooms (booked through Priceline) didn't have the new LCD screen TV's and the fancy square lamps. My room smelled fresh and everything was kept perfectly clean. The bathroom was slightly dated, but clean. The third floor garden was a real oasis, and you can get a great shot of the LA skyline from up there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for it's location!”
Reviews.Author: Miratio
Reviews.Content: Although I'm not a huge fan of Downtown LA, I enjoyed my stay at the Kyoto Grand. I was in town for a convention at the Center so it's proximity was important (within 2 miles of convention center and Staples stadium). Fortunately there was a shuttle going to and from, otherwise the transit was a bit loopy to get there. The Good: The gardens in the hotel are stunning! Having breakfast outside in the gardens was wonderful and I really enjoyed that part of the hotel. The staff were quick with check in and room service. The food was delicious (I had a chicken caesar salad). The beds were well made and comfortable. The Bad: The overall location of the hotel is a bit wishy-washy. It is mostly a business district and doesn't have much appeal surrounding the hotel. There are a few restaurants dotted around the area at least. The view along one side of the hotel is a giant flat grey wall of another building. It was a little disappointing. The layout of the hotel is a bit cramped, and the angled hallways can be confusing and a bit creepy with all the corners. There is no pool! The Ugly: Nothing comes to mind that was overly bad about this hotel. Good experience!

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet place in the heart of downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: jim_from_sf
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, spacious and modern. The rooftop garden was like heaven on earth, and we did spend some time there reading while waiting to attend Thanksgiving festivities with family. The location is very convenient and it's quick to get onto 101 just a few blocks away. And little Tokyo with its restaurants is a short walk away...yes you can actually walk from this hotel in LA! The only negatives: No pool or even a hot tub. Parking was costly, but we later realized that there is a lot across the street half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected. Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: jrkin
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by the photos. The rooms are not all updated. I booked through hotwire.com and received a dated, musty smelling and dusty room. I actually wiped everything down with soap and listerine (no antibacterial wipes). I aired out the room before I went to sleep and that helped. The showerhead was scummy looking and the shower curtains were old and in need of changing. I only stayed in the room long enough to sleep a couple of hours and change my clothes. It was not the retreat I expected. I should have stayed at the Omni. They are always consistent, clean and I know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “"grand" as in "huge" - not "grand" as in "great"”
Reviews.Author: aquitoeternity
Reviews.Content: the service was great but the room was very so-so. the bathroom esp had this extremely noisy fan that would not turn off. so every bathroom visit was cold and noisy. i thought the word "Grand" would mean it would be better than smaller hotels but it just means "bigger" - all in all : not a terrible hotel by any means but i wont return here because the rooms need updating. this place was probably truly "grand" and cutting-edge in the 80's but those days are gone. also: parking garage: inconvenient and noisy. the valet and staff were all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I love Kyoto Grand Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jigo
Reviews.Content: It's such a pleasure for those who quite often travel on business, to be pleasantly surprised by what appears to be a modest hotel stay. Not only was I delighted by the warm atmosphere and design of the hotel but the minute I walked in, the service was amazing! Particularly Marisela, at the Front Desk is probably a great reason why I keep coming back - I so appreciate her hospitality. Her customer service skills has also set this hotel apart from other places that I stay in LA. That goes to show, the first impression is always the last! Thanks Marisela!

Reviews.Title: “Privacy Plus Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: HapH
Reviews.Content: Best part was no kids running in hallways, or noise from adjacent rooms. (Cannot say the same thing for the outside - sirens from police cars, fire trucks, and ambulances kept us rural folk waking up. I was there from Hawaii for a heart procedure at White memorial and 2 days' recuperation before returning to Hawaii. Peace and quiet was what I needed. Special thanks to Jose and Isaac the hotel van drivers...they could NOT have been more helpful, reliable and up beat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: thedude35504
Reviews.Content: I had booked this room before reading reviews online, as I was desperate to get a room for the BCS national championship game. After reading reviews on here as recently as late 2009, I was concerned that I had made a mistake. Reviews on overbooked rooms, unclean rooms, unfriendly staff, etc. had my stomach in knots as I landed in LA. This hotel, however, fully exceeded my expectations in every aspect. I flew all the way from the friendly southeast (GA), and upon arrival felt like I had not left. The staff up front was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and inviting. The bed (we upgraded to the pillowtop king room) was EXTREMELY comfortable. The shower had great water pressure. The room was quiet (it was a street side room not over the garden). We never heard people beside us, over, or under us. Their conceirege was always in the lobby walking around and very accessible. Anytime we were in the lobby looking lost, he would walk up and offer friendly help and advice. The only slight negative (and the hotel staff can't do anything to fix it) is the location. Its not the best, not the worst. The only big tourist stuff it's close too is olvera st., union station, chinatown, and little tokyo (of course). If you don't mind walking a few blocks in the beautiful weather to the metro, though, you have access to a ton of tourist attractions. They also have a shuttle van that will take you to the metro and other points within a few miles of the hotel. I did feel very safe in the area, as it is close to police stations. Overall, I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to a friend. The hotel was definitely one of the highlights of the trip, along with BAMA winning the national championship...ROLL TIDE!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't upgrade the important stuff!”
Reviews.Author: JDawgSupreme
Reviews.Content: Every year we stay at a hotel for Christmas to enjoy time together. We chose Kyoto Grand because the picture's were impressive and the website boasted how the hotel had been recently been updated. While this isn't a lie, they certainly skipped out on some aspects of the renovation. My first and biggest complaint is the bed. I've lived in college dorm rooms, stayed in many hotels and this, by far, was one of the most uncomfortable beds i've slept in. While the room itself also looked nice, the bathroom could have definitely used some of the renovations dollars. It was rather old and outdated. Another reviewer also commented on the hotel staff. They did seem like we were interrupting their work by checking in and checking out. They were not the most helpful. The location of the hotel is pretty good, though, if you know LA. You're pretty close to a lot of great restaurants and areas. So not all is bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but very unprofessional customer service by receptionist MARIA”
Reviews.Author: jpmodesto
Reviews.Content: Walked into this beautiful hotel and got in line for about 15 minutes. Once approached the front counter, Maria had an attitude and she did not even greet me. Her first statements were somewhere in the lines of "you have a reservation right?" We went through the reservation and she asked me to come back in 30 minutes so I found a seat near the front desk and for 30 minutes I watched over 20 parties of guests checking in and not one of them were asked to wait. After 30 minutes passed, she was left the front desk and was replaced with another receptionist. I was suppose to be able to go straight to her and not get in line but she was nowhere to be found and she didnt even notify me before she left. So I got in line again and waited another 10-15 minutes and I finally see her walking in and out of the backroom while I was standing in line so I left the line and chased her. When I finally got her attention, she didnt even remember or recognize me. I had to explain what she asked me to do. I was really angry at this point so I asked her why I had to wait and she showed no sympathy and just kept repeating, "you're room wasnt ready." I kept asking her, why didnt you assign a different room? Why did take me almost 1hour to get my keys? I even asked her if the fact that I am an employee of the State of California and receiving a discount on the room rate was a reason. Either way, for the first time in my life, I was treated like a 2nd rate/class consumer. She did not greet me, she wasnt comforting with the wait, she didnt even apologize or try to make my experience better after my complaint. This is by far the worst customer service treatment I have received in my entire life. I get better service buying food from a street vendor. I even invited 2 other couples to stay in the hotel that evening so we can carpool to our New Years Eve festivities. I shouldnt have done that. Overall, the hotel is nice and the location is in the heart of downtown Los Angeles in Little Tokyo and is accessible from plenty of tourist attractions. However, the fact that I received such horrible customer service treatment, I doubt I will ever stay at this hotel nor recommend it to anyone I know. In fact, I am in such disappointment and feel offended that I WANT to share my bad experience to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but website can be very misleading.”
Reviews.Author: OneAfter909
Reviews.Content: The kyoto grand was everything we could ask for in a hotel. We are so used to staying in best westerns, holiday inn etc. that we forgot what a real hotel experience is supposed to be. The self parking is located underground which isnt as fancy as the rest of the hotel but hey who cares right? The elevator takes you straight into the hotel where it has an enormous lobby area decorated with japanese paintings and other exotic decor, which made us go "WOW!" Now this is the reason why im rating this a 4 instead of a 5. i booked the "Deluxe" room with a king bed directly on the Kyoto Grand website. As pictured on the site, the deluxe room is the remolded room thats decorated in dark brown colors and specifically a 42'' flat screen tv, this is the room i booked. After checking in, we proceeded up to the room only to find that its one of the "old" rooms thats labled as the "standard" room on the website. The standard rooms are decorated in very light colors with a 25'' or so tv, very different from the deluxe rooms. So i went back down to the front desk and told them the situation, Maria at the front desk double checked my reservation on the system and she said that that room is whati booked! now the standard room rate was about $98 and the deluxe room was about $117, i did not pay the extra money to get one of those old standard rooms! (you can verify the differences between the two on the kyoto grand website when you get to the reservations page w/ the rooms/rates, there are specific and obvious differences between the standard and deluxe rooms even in the description)But Maria was nice enough (given the fact taht it wasnt really busy) gave me the upgrade to the deluxe remodeled room. The deluxe remodeled rooms are amazing and breathtaking! the huge 42'' tv kept us from being bored, the decor was very warm and relaxing, everything about the room was A++++++. So all in, the rooms, service, location were picture perfect except for the EXTREMELY MISLEADING room descriptions on the website. i hope the management reads this review to prevent this from happening again. People are being ripped off for paying the extra money for a remodeled deluxe room only to get the old standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: atrig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight here after his company's holiday party. The hotel was just ok. The decor is nothing like what is pictured on the website. It looks like something out of a holiday inn in middle America from the 70's. The pictures on the website are from one corner of the lobby area and the room pictured looked like it may have even been from another hotel. We didnt dine here, so I cant comment on the food. Overnight parking is $25 in their garage, and that's pretty much the only overnight option in the area. I'm luke warm on this one......

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but don't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: meybr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kyoto Grand Hotel for three nights for a convention happening in the convention center. Since I left to register at the last minute, most of the other hotels were already sold out. The hotel room was nice, but it was a little bit outdated. I'd say the bathroom needs some remodeling. The hotel site says they offer a complimentary shuttle within a three mile radius of the hotel. I was only able to use this complimentary service 1 out of 3 times I needed. One time they told us they were busy and another time they told me that they only did a 2 mile radius when I asked to go to the convention center and couldn't take me there. I also had problems with the Internet on my first night and couldn't use it to find a restaurant close to the hotel. So I asked their "concergie", i.e. front desk, for suggestions for a nice restaurant not very far. They ended up sending me to a restaurant that was already closed and they even gave me the wrong address. Ended up going back to the hotel since the cab driver couldn't suggest anything and had dinner there - the food was horrible (Rendezvous). The hotel doesn't have anything close by and is not safe to walk around at night. They have a complimentary fitness center. It's just Ok. It's very small and the treadmill is kind of old, already tearing. In a matter of one month, the ranking of this hotel has already dropped from 54 to 60.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK hotel in a terrible location”
Reviews.Author: rperryaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a terrible location. It is not conveniently located close to anything. The service in the restaurant for breakfast was terrible. Front desk service was good. Hotel is in need of a refurbishment. $30 dollars to park your car each day.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but i wouldn't want to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Renee79Seattle
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel thru hotwire.com which i would not do again but i got a great deal. the hotel is nice, some of the staff was friendly, some were a little stuck up. my room was okay the bed was really soft & comfortable. i didn't like the bathroom it needed to be upgraded. i was very disappointed that there was no vending machine and ice machine on my floor, they said they did have one but honestly they don't. plus no room service during my stay...the restaurant that does the room service closed at 2pm?! oh that's nice. thank god there was a starbucks next to the hotel and a gift shop in the hotel but the prices were a little too high. $3.00 for a little travel size toothpaste are you kidding me?! i don't understand why they charge so much for parking, internet, room service and other stuff but their hotel is so outdated? it doesn't even come close to the hilton...at least the hilton has room service all day and a airport shuttle and their bathrooms are nicer. the next time i come to LA i'll stay at a more reliable hotel like the hilton. the kyoto grand sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: dopeschool
Reviews.Content: After reading osme reviews on this site, I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel. It sounded like a mixed bag. Our experience here was great, though. The inside of the hotel was very nice and the rooms were large and stylish. It's in a great location as it's around the corner from Little Tokyo and it's only 4 blocks from Disney Hall and the Music Center. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Suzelle
Reviews.Content: Our regular hotel location in the downtown LA area was booked up and so we needed an alternate location for our small business group. It was a welcome experience and the sales staff was very welcoming in the package they'd put together for us. Bell staff was not quite as available as we'd like, but it all worked out. Not sure if more than 1 elevator was running at one point, so it seemed I must have made ca. 15 stops on the way down from the 20th floor. This hotel is in a more pedestrian friendly location. Did not have time opportunity to take advantage of the restaurants, but did enjoy an evening stroll about their Gardens. It was very easy to exit the 101 and return to the 101.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulruszczyk
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel a lot. We booked through Expedia and got a great rate. It was less than $100 per night and that included taxes. The lobby is beautiful and the room was very nice and clean. A great feature is the free shuttle that will take you anywhere within 3 miles. It is not always available but it was available most of the time. The hotel is right near Little Tokyo and a couple of Japanese markets both of which are fun to explore. Around the corner from the hotel is the "Senka" coffee shop which serves better coffee than the Starbucks in the hotel. The staff was very helpful. For the price, which is less than we paid for a hotel in Schenectady, NY, the hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManuelN
Reviews.Content: Just a good hotel, rooms look new and quite posh. Only minus was the annoying noise making fridge but you can plug it out of course as we did. Easy to get to a subway or bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: RICHARDLONDON41
Reviews.Content: We chose thios hotel as it was close to the station and we were arriving late by train. It was a pretty poor experience. First we were take t o a room that was already occupied, when that was resolved the hotel garden which is its ain selling poiunt wass closed for a private function. The front desk was quite helpful and suggested a tour for us but the only decent dining choices ere Japanese so we had to eat in the bar. The room was ok but towels were thredbare. We were booked ii on a breakfast in clusive package but the breakfast was poor and service variable. On the second night the hotel restaurant was closed for a dance class, there was no pre-warning nor any notices outside to tell you this. Unsurprisingly my request for a late check out was refused. Overall this was a pretty poor hotel withb only rudimentary customer service and claearly designed for Japanese tour groups. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location mediocre quality.”
Reviews.Author: timeflies111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of Little Tokyo and parking costs $24 per night but the price if stay wasn't bad -$115/night. The quality and upkeep of the room still needs a lot of work. They definitely don't match te pictures online. I've been goig to this hotel for years and it used to be top notch. But management has changed and it definitey shows. Staff was horrible , especially grumpy old man at te front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet and nice.”
Reviews.Author: msq007
Reviews.Content: We were in L.A. for our son's brain surgery and needed to stay downtown near the hospital. This hotel was a quiet oasis away from the chaos of Los Angeles. We loved the Japanese garden and our room was beautiful. The service was great and we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great food”
Reviews.Author: af01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, when we visited LA as the last stop on route 66. The hotel is located in the Japanese district just a few blocks from downtown (it takes you 10 minutes walking). The hotel is very nice, the rooms are good in size and the bed comfortable. The garden is a nice touch, it is not on the top of the hotel, but on 4th or 5th floor limiting the view. We eat at the Thousand Cranes restaurant. It was really good, but pricy too. I would though recommend the experience, order the "Shabu shabu" it is a great experience and worth it all (don't be afraid to ask the waiter for "directions" on how to eat it, they are very helpful). There is a parking garage under the building, parking is 25 USD/24 hours. We noted that, that there is a open air parking area just on the other side of the street only charging 8 USD/24 areas, if we had seen that we would probarbly have used that instead. All-in-all, the hotel offered great value for money, and I would recommend this hotel when visiting LA downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Too many things we didn't like”
Reviews.Author: MiguelGarciaGonzalez
Reviews.Content: Location of Grand Kioto Hotel and Gardens is great if you're planning to go anywhere in LA Downtown. They have even a free shuttle service to mostly any hot spot in downtown. Problems started with the room. We had a booking for a Deluxe King Room (Reservation was done at their own website), and what we got was a Room corresponding the Standard Room description. Despite of the complaints all we've got was "we'll try to do it better next time, but descriptions in the internet are not correct as the pictures you see belong to executive rooms and not deluxe" Workers are not very kind. If we had a question they didn't care, if I gave them one of the little milk jars in breakfast with a fly in it, they just stared at me until I asked them to change it. And if you are planning to wake up early please be aware they have the garden for party purposes, jazz concerts, weddings... so probably you'll get quite a noisy atmosphere. (There were events in 2 out of 4 nights we spent there). Great location... that's all

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel With Beautiful Room, Comfy Bed, Great Food”
Reviews.Author: BarbieJ62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice before when it was The New Otani, 2 years ago & 5 years ago. It is the most convenient hotel to the office I work in while in Los Angeles. I loved it then but the renovations have made it even more beautiful. I just miss a couple of the lovely decorations from the lobby & the restaurant. I enjoyed the room updates - fluffy, puffy, comfy new bedding, flatscreen TV, new wallpaper & carpet. The hot breakfast I had time to enjoy 2 mornings was a great start to the day, & the dinner I had one night in the Rendevous Lounge was delicious & beautiful (Mandarin Chicken served in a laquered box complete with lid like I was getting a gift!), & they had my favorite hard-to-find wine (Copperidge Chardonnay). Desk clerk Erica who checked me in & bartender Moses (aka "Mo") were wonderful to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScenicLover803
Reviews.Content: Our dissatisfied stay at Kyoto Grand started with an unfriendly staff at the front desk. When I asked the staff about the parking meter enforcement schedule, she said she doesn't know and was trying to get me to go with their valet parking ($30/night) which I declined. Then, she replied me with the "park at your own risk" phrase. We got a room on the 12th floor facing the rooftop garden and there was a party at the garden that night. The music was really loud and it continued until a bit after midnight. Since I already know about this from the other reviewers and we didn't need to sleep early that night, I could cope with that. However, the worst thing came When we were ready to retire for the night. We found hairs and small debris on the bed. It is obvious that the sheet didn't get changed from the previous stay. I called the front desk but all they could offer is a cleaned bed sheet for us to put on ourselve. I'm not sure if we received this kind of service because we got the room via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lobby, roof, rooms beautiful, parking garage employee awlful & enough for me to think twice about coming back.”
Reviews.Author: sarahsteffen
Reviews.Content: The hotel emplyee collecting money upon departure from parking garage is obviously pocketing customers payment and required 'proof' that we were hotel guests and that we must have paper documentaion to prove we could recieve the $18 leaving feel (what a deal). While he made us feel rushed and we frantacally looked though our suitcases as there were other cards trying to leave, he refused to call the front desk stating, 'he would never get through, and he'd have to wait on hold." After we firmly stated we would not be paying an addition $18 (from what we had paid 5 minutes prior at the front desk) he called thr front desk and immedatly confirmed he were in fact guests. Everything else about the hotel was great, especially the rooftop garden where I was attending a wedding. Just not the best way to end it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Amtrak, Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: oysterfiend
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after cancelling a 4 day cruise that was no longer going to Ensenada Mexico. We had just been on a 7 day Mexican Riviera cruise to No- Where - because of swine flu and didn't fancy another 4 days. After our first night back to Long Beach and Queen Mary hotel we struggled to find any information from Tourist info centres about the greater California area and accommodation choices. California -USA does not seem to have very informative Tourist information centres- they only cover their immediate areas and are more of a collective point for advertising rather than assistance. We were told this hotel was close to amtrak and to try it. We stayed one night before going to Santa Barbara on Amtrak. It cost us About $155 US for the night. We didn't want to pay anymorem as not going on our cruise meant we had to be mindful of our budget. Our room was quite high up and we could see over the hotels Japanese gardens. The staff were pleasant and helpful and we were happy with our stay. There were lots of Japanese restaurants close by and Mexican as well. Also a starbuck cafe at hotel base- ground level. We were given a ride in hotel's shuttle to Amtrak the following morning which we appreciated. I am surprised by the negative reviews from people who paid way less than us- I really don't know what some people expect. In comparison to our stay here we were shocked by the charges for rooms in Santa Barbara which offered far less for more money. If we came to Los angeles again we'd be happy to stay here but would try to get a better price as its obvious from reviews some people do.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: maniacarcy
Reviews.Content: The room was not what was advertised on the website. We reserved a Deluxe Room, which we dedided on upon seeing the pictures and we were given a standard room. We had to change rooms because of a horrible smell, but the second room was no different. When we spoke to Management they told us the room was a more than actually an upgrade, which I don't know what an upgrade to what? We ended up rather loosing our money and went to a different Hotel around midnight.

Reviews.Title: “I don't miss you”
Reviews.Author: VeranusEP
Reviews.Content: Before arrival I got a special message from Kyoto about a 50% off at their restaurant. Just check in and ask at the clerk. Well they did not know anything about it. And I'm still waiting for an answer. Instead I've got a new mail from them, promising a 10% on the next booking subject "WE already miss you". Well... the executive room was poor. Furniture ancient, toilette small, the overall impression was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “The most infuriating hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: SuomynonaNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine. The rooms are not as well designed as I had expected. They're standard mid tier hotel rooms. My issue is not with the amenities or the rooms. It's with the horrendously loud music we had to deal with every night of our stay. They opened a lounge on the rooftop garden, which is on the third floor. Several floors of rooms are above the deck so when there is a party, the music is so loud, you can't hear someone talking to you in the same room. My husband and I were traveling with our one year old son so this became a huge issue. After the first night, I asked if there would be any more parties during the restof our stay and was assured there wouldn't be. The next night, the music was back and my son once again was miserable from exhaustian. When I once again expressed my displeasure, the hotel supervisor apologized but offered no palatable solution. It was obvious that I was not the only one to complain. This hotel may be reasonably priced, but if younare looking for any amount of peace and quiet as well as decent customer service, go elsewhere. They don't deserve your business.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star for Under $100 and well worth it”
Reviews.Author: ssitravel08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply a gem. I stayed here for business back in January and I was very pleased with the hotel. The hotel has a very chill/zen feel to it to it which was nice to come back to after being in meetings all day. There are a few really nice ponds around the hotel that I saw that added to the zen feel of the hotel. The dining room over looks one of the ponds with a waterfall which was really nice. If you are in LA for business and looking for a chill hotel then you should check this one out. The best part, you can usually book it for under $100 which is a great price. I booked mine on EasyClickTravel.com.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cookb
Reviews.Content: The room was more than what we expected, we stayed in the deluxe room, which was very nice. The garden area was great and we enjoyed having cocktails and appetizers while listening to great music. The staff was very nice and we truely enjoyed our stay. The only down side, we were there for a Dodger game and I'd suggest they have shuttles specifically for that. Something that will take and pick you up after the game, no matter the time. We had to take a cab, which wasn't a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location but not a lot of food places nearby”
Reviews.Author: Ariean
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and got the room for a great price of $75 a night for a king bed room from their website. We found our room to be of great value, the hotel itself was very nice and grand, we liked the lobby, the garden was only okay for me but it is very nice. The room was spacious with a nice big flat screen tv, the bathroom was also very nice, clean and spacious, the toiletries provided (shampoo etc) was only ok - didn't lather very much, but the soaps were nice. There was also a hairdryer. The fridge didn't seem to be plugged in.. the best thing about the room though was the bed! You have to have a good bed to crash in at night and this was definitely one of the best beds we slept on, the pillows were plentiful and also very comfortable. The hotel was very close to the civic center metro station (takes maybe 10-15mins walk), also union station. There were restaurants in the hotel but were expensive (we didn't get to eat there), we had a bad experience trying to get food around late afternoon (3-5pm) and there were not a lot of food places nearby!! It's in downtown Los Angeles which was mainly buildings and offices and not much of shopping and the sort (there was mall or something behind the hotel but we didn't really check that out). There was a police station very close by which may bother some people as there were sirens going off very often and at night or in the early morning but it didn't bother us so much. It's around 20-30mins taxi from LAX and cost us 39 dollars. Their wifi was not free, it wasn't the fastest connection either. To conclude, Kyoto was a good hotel, I'd rate it a 4.5, would definitely stay again when back in LA, and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Thierry_Swiss
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and the LCD TV very big. The location is in downtown, right in the Little Tokyo area. From the 19th floor we could see the 4th July fireworks around the city. The parking is pretty expensive (24$) you can park easily in the Little tokyo Mall next to it! The downside, staff very bad and rude!

Reviews.Title: “OK if you don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: HikaruDragon
Reviews.Content: We paid $70 on Priceline. They must put Priceline customers in rooms that haven't been updated--our TV was not a flatscreen as previous reviewers had mentioned, nor was our bed too firm--quite the opposite! The bed was like sleeping on a block of Jello and so unsupportive that we had backaches the next morning. We had a small refrigerator, but it didn't fit in the cabinet, so it sat in front of the cabinet on the floor. As mentioned by others, the hotel parking is limited and expensive. After one night in self-park, we parked across the street for $5 flat rate (weekend rate). Be warned that you are expected to pay the next day's rate in the morning. The morning attendant threatened to fine us $200 if we didn't pay immediately (we had gone down to the car just to pick up some items and had no money with us & had to call the family member in the hotel room to bring the fee). The room, although on the small side, was cozy and had a small walk-in closet with a safe and built-in dresser and ledge for suitcases. We brought our laptop but ended up using the internet for free in the business center. Since we enjoy Japanese cuisine and shopping, I would say proximity to Japantown was the #1 draw of this hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: redladya
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good food, reasonable* rates. Rooms are a bit smaller than expected, but quite comfortable. The "gardens" were slightly misleading, as all they seemed to have were a small garden in the restaurant on the 3rd floor-for some reason, from the pictures I expected a large-ish koi pond, something like at Disenyland hotel, but there was just a small waterfall in a small patio & a few plants-no fish, just water, & they were closed off for a private party. *Beware the "parking included" rate. Their parking garage is very small-we couldn't slef-park, there were no spaces (although plenty of room in valet, of course). I explained this at check-in, & said they should at least reimburse for the self-park -vs- valet, but when I got the bill in my room the next morning, parking had been added. So I ended up paying about $40 more than the original quoted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off even at half price”
Reviews.Author: cazzizol
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 star hotel off priceline bidding $65 a night and ended up staying here. The lobby and room looked nice. Then found out they charge an extra $24 a night for parking. Their restaurant charges $7 for a bagel with cream cheese. They wouldn't let me use any microwave in the building to heat up my own food. They don't offer wireless/breakfast with the room. And the front desk service was poor. Skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion with College Friends”
Reviews.Author: jazzy2SoCal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a peaceful retreat for a weekend away. It was "sold-out" for both nites of our stay but it was surprisingly quiet in our rooms. There were many "Rave" teens among the guests which made for interesting people-watching. Maria - at the Front Desk was very helpful in providing service. Would suggest a speedy check-out system as the lines gets very long around noon. The shuttle service is spotty at best. The breakfast buffet at the Azalea is wonderful with Japanese as well as American items. Business center was convenient. Parking is a hassle here with a hefty price for valet & self-park.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler80
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, but had a strange smell to it. The parking garage was over crowded and once you add in the daily parking fee, the price of the hotel isn't really a good deal. The fitness center's equipment was either broken or not functioning correctly because it's so old.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great; Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Cando
Reviews.Content: The Grand Kyoto is pretty good, but NOTHING about it is "grand," by any stretch of the imagination. My 6 day stay allowed me ample opportunity to assess this. I had a small, irregularly-shaped room in the corner of this triangle-shaped building. It overlooked an adjacent courtyard full of Japanese businesses, not affiliated with the hotel. Bed was reasonably comfortable, bathroom had been renovated but wasn't really attractive. Sink faucet was hard to turn off completely. Room was clean. Refrigerator in room was convenient. It seemed to me like the New Otani (former owner) tried to build a hotel in a grand style, but the current owners are trying to renovate and run it on the cheap, and it shows. The real problem in this hotel is service. People who are supposed to provide service in this hotel are clueless. Local TV stations were not coming in -- but in 5 days, no one in this hotel could get the cable company to fix what was wrong. My radio was broken -- it took two calls, the second, very insistent, to get it fixed. Someone else's charges were charged to my room -- it took more time to straighten this out than it should have. There was no concierge available during the 6 days of my stay -- only the desk clerks, usually only one per shift. When I arrived, there was no bellhop -- I had to bring my suitcases up to my room unassisted. There simply weren't enough people working in the hotel, and the ones who were there could stand re-training. Neighborhood was very safe during day; I never walked around unaccompanied at night. Lots of Japanese and other restaurants nearby, and yogurt places (Yogurt Land at San Pedro and First is even better than Pinkberry.) Also markets and interesting shops. Location is walking distance to Walt Disney Concert Hall (excellent docent-let tours of all 4 theaters are available,) museums and the Cathedral. I think this is a reasonable choice for business travelers, or for adults without children traveling for pleasure. I booked a $99 rate for weekdays, $79 for weekend days on the hotel's website. Neither breakfast nor parking were included, but internet access in the business center was available free of charge. I consider this hotel a bargain and would recommend it -- with caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you are on a business trip/overnight”
Reviews.Author: ginger1234LasVegas
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews on line about this hotel and saw it was a great price for the location. I decided to book it, because my boys, ages 13, and 6 are big Dodgers fans, and we had planned on two Dodgers games this specific week. We had read the hotel was only 2.5 miles away from the stadium. Upon arriving, construction was underway with the front desk, so we were asked to step aside to the Make shift front desk to check in. Not a big deal. We had checked in to our room which was surprisingly very nice, with the exception of our mini refrigerator not working. We called the front desk and they were more than happy and timely in replacing. it. Excited with our children we decided to go and look for the pool to spend time waiting for the game to start. My fault, the hotel does not have one, but has a "Supposed" Garden to sit in. The kids not so much into it. Decided to go and get something to eat for lunch, but every restaurant was either closed or sushi. Wasn't going to work out so well with the children of course. Again if you are on a busines trip go!! Decided to walk the area around the hotel to find a restaurant to eat,but .....we are in the middle of downtown.....Little Tokyo .....ghetto, whatever you may call it. Found nothing except, the court house, police station so forth, typical downtown area. We dealt with it. Went back to the Kyoto, asked the concierge how could we get to the Dodgers stadium? The concierge informed us, take the courtesy shuttle to Union Station and catch a train to the stadium. Wow!! That sounds fantastic. Get on the shuttle, the gentleman driving is making small talk asking why are we going to Union Station and he explaings, he doesn't think there is a train to Dodgers stadium. At this point we are sure the concierge must be right so we decide to go forth with the Union Station idea. No Surprise, the irritated train worker let me know they no longer provided transportation to Dodgers Stadium. On the way out of Union Station, once again disapointed we noticed a sign turned backwards that said 'We no longer provide transportation to Dodgers Stadium". Why did we not see the sign prior to the courtesy shuttle leaving. We lugged ourselves and kids back to the hotel, via foot, and the concierge actually said, Oh your back already??? Seriously, the place was a joke. The bar supposedly on the roof was entertainment beyond anything else. Just as a test, we decided to order a drink off of the "specialty drink" menu, because we saw the bartender having trouble making a Cosmopolitan. OMG, the drink literally, took 3o minutes to appear, and being in the business, I am, I know, it was nowhere near what the actual recipe read. The bartender was reading the label for Lime Juice. This place sucks, all bars and restaurants close by 9pm. Business Trip yes vacation NO!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MVSpirit
Reviews.Content: I had to have medical tests at USC Medical Facuity. Having the shuttle available to take and pick me up meant less stress for me. I accidently left my reading glasses in the van. When Rafael noticed he took my glasses back to the hospital for fear I would need the. Everyone I came into contact with was friendly and very helpful during this very uncertain time for me. I was not there looking for entertainment, I was there for healing, so sorry, can't tell you anything about the night life. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was amazing and I enjoyed watching the flatscreen TV.”
Reviews.Author: dtanikawa
Reviews.Content: The bed was heavenly -especially after a long workday. Was also nice to enjoy watching TV and a large Flat-screen. Enjoyed the new roof-top bar and Azalea's restaurant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “awesome complex”
Reviews.Author: Stokesfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: Was there for only one night but the experience was definitely worth returning. The lobby is huge and beautiful with the bar just beyond check-in. There is a boutique, restaurant and nightclub for those looking to shop, eat and party. Room are nicely moderate, though on the small side. Appreciated the japanese decor and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just Terrible”
Reviews.Author: raisinsSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation approximately 2 weeks prior to my business trip to Los Angeles. I received an e-mail confirmation prior to my arrival. When I arrived at the hotel at 6:30pm there was a huge line of angry customers. When I was finally able to speak with a front desk agent I was advised that they had over-booked the hotel and that I had been re-booked at a hotel in Pasadena. However, I had work in downtown LA beginning at 7:00am, which is why I made a reservation in downtown LA, not "Pasadena". When I advised the agent & the hotel manager that I could not stay in Pasadena they told me that I had no other choice. When I insisted they indicated that they were able to find a room for me in the mid-Wilshire area. They claimed that the hotel was a beautiful "boutique" hotel. Assuming "boutique" is the industry lingo for "dump" then I indeed was placed in a "boutique" hotel. There were cigarette burns in the carpet, it was filthy, water damage on the walls, broken mirrors, no food service etc.... Upon my arrival, I left a message for the Manager of the Kyoto Grand, but have not heard from him since. I have historically stayed at the New Otani - now the Kytoto Grand on numerous occassions, but I will not be returning - nor will my co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a lot more, based on word of mouth.”
Reviews.Author: braddah
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, it was obvious that the previous occupant had just left and that the cleaning staff did not pay attention to the details. Floor dirty. No Fiji drinking awater available. Soap and shampoo from previous occupant still open and in the bathub.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected displeasure”
Reviews.Author: mpalmaPalmdale_Ca
Reviews.Content: first of all, front desk stated rooms were over booked they tried to book us at a hotel in Pasadena ! we had a retirement engagement at the Kyoto hotel, my room i was promised never was booked for me ? i requested a room with city view upper floors 12-16 none were offered to me, my room was small and odor wasnt appealing, when checking out , i was charged for water bottles $5 each fir water i didnt even drink ! maybe thats a way of getting extra money from your visitors ? poor poor poor...

Reviews.Title: “Poor and Unfriendly Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DREWMET
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were rude, wait staff in restaurant were rude, reservation was not accurate upon arrival and were forced to pay for breakfast even though rate was an online "best available rate with breakfast."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Randall-MD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kyoto Grand for a conference that was at the LA Convention Center, and it was quite nice. It wasn't terribly convienant for that conference, but since the conference provided a shittle, it wasnt a big deal. It was nice to be in Little Tokyo, and the food nearby was quite good.The Kyoto provided coupons for free breakfast every day, and they did an excellent job of that. The only downside to the hotel in my opinion was the beds. They are pretty firm. I slept well, but the bed took a little getting used to. I would recommend this hotel for anyone, but be sure to have a car if you want to get to other attractions around LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for Downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: TJSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I paid $169.00 for a Deluxe King Room. This is about $120.00 less than other suitable hotels in the area. I have stayed a couple of times at this property before (when it went under a different name) and had always thought that it needed a rennovation. Fortunately the new ownership has heeded my silent advice. The room was spacious, clean, modern and decorated with a hint of Asian flair. The tolietries were well above average and there was both coffee and tea service in my room. The bed was a little firm for my liking but overall the room was very comfortable. The hotel is a lot of fun to explore with its Japanese garden, bars and eateries. I went to happy hour in the lobby bar and had a great time hanging out with Moe the bartender. He is a lot of fun to talk to and he made me like a regular.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Aninkas
Reviews.Content: It was worth to stay there. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: BlOOmingt0nGal
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The gardens are beautiful and a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clkaka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was very close, walking distance to a class my husband had to attend. Everything about the hotel was wonderful in my opinion, The room was very nice, of course they upgraded us to a Business class room, loved it, it was perfect for what we needed, it had a refrigerator, and coffee maker in the room, also upon check in they gave us 4 breakfast buffet coupons for our stay, that was a nice touch i thought. The beds were very comfortable. They seem to be renovating the place so a few floors above us there was some hammering but it dint seem to bother us at all. Cant wait to come back to this hotel when the renovations are done, Oh and when you do stay here make sure you go down to the lobby bar area for happy hour and have a glass of wine or 2, at 3.00 a glass thats a great deal, and they also have some appetizers half off, and they have a wonderful Cheese and Fruit platter that was great!, and don't forget to say hi to Moe the bartender,he is one of the good ones. The neighborhood was safe, theres a little mall you can walk to down the street that has a riteaide in there, but it closes early, and there is also a little Tokyo market and a bunch of restaurants and shops right behind the hotel, The hotel shuttle will also take you up to 3 miles if you want to do dinner somewhere other then there. I will stay here again it was a great price and everything was wonderful, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Funky smelling and out of date”
Reviews.Author: Gone2TheBeachPhoenix
Reviews.Content: The Kyoto Grand needs to drop the word 'Grand' from its name. Upon entering the hotel, I first noticed the odd odor. Not a bad odor, just a stale odor. The hotel was probably nice in the 70's, but it does not appear to have been updated since then. The food quality in the restaurants was average. The rooms were below average. I found the beds to be very hard but that is a matter of personal preference. While the hotel is convenient for walking in downtown LA, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: OjaiTraveler18
Reviews.Content: The Romabce Package is by far one of the finest values we have ever experienced. The Hotel, Employees, Front Desk and Restaurants are first class and the room was as good or better than the best we have stayed in previously. We have nothing but praise for the Kyoto - Perfect! Please keep up the good work. I would not hesttate a second to make your hotel the base for any Los Angeles visit.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaneoheBoy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online and booked it because of the price, but I will certainl stay here again. Located in the heart of Little Toyko, the Kyoto Grand is a very nice property with large clean rooms. I loved the fact that there are so many Japanese and Asian stores and restaurants very nearby. There is a great little shopping area with a neat Japanese bookstore and Marukai Market, a well known Japanese supermarket. Try the storefront "Curry to Go" for tasty Japanese curry on Onizuka Blvd. Within walking distance (about 6 blocks) to Walt Disney Concert Hall. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Little Toykyo”
Reviews.Author: Nomad2009
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly please with hotel. Nice atmosphere. Location was nice. Hotel does need updating and plumbing needed some help. Overall would stay again. Staff was not as helpful in local area amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Gret hotel in the heart of little tokio!”
Reviews.Author: Raquel10
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely in awe and shock when we pulled up to the hotel - it does not look like a 69 dollar place! It is very posh with great staff and furniture. The rooms overlooked a garden inside the hotel (yes on a terrace on the lower floors). Very quiet and the rooms were pretty big. I would defintely recomed it! The location is very central, just don´t wander off at night, the neighborhood can be a bit dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Grand”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel only because it is where the conference I was speaking at was being held. The hotel clearly caters to a Japanese tourist crowd. The good: Good selection of TV channels, good hot water and pressure, lovely Japanese garden complete with water feature and nice views, proximity to Little Tokyo and City Hall. Banquet catering was surprisingly good for a conference hotel. The not so good: No electric outlets at the desk, a single plastic cup in the bathroom (I expect that at Motel 6, but not at a downtown “luxury” hotel), very loud HVAC which woke me up every time it came on as it made a big clunk (luckily the weather was cool enough at night for sleeping with the windows open), foam pillows, only mirror in my very small room was in the bathroom – not even full-length. The other: Very hard beds as reported in other posts, yet surprisingly comfortable; Entire hotel needs updating. Decent breakfast buffet with very attentive coffee service. Did not use the fitness center. Japanese restaurants on-site were very pricey but I have heard they are good. Lots of other dining options – particularly Japanese – within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “above my expectations, too good to be true!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beom
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent, When every I have to go to LA again, I know where to stay. I super loved it!!!!! service, location, price value is excellent!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, decent hotel, great staff but a very hard bed!”
Reviews.Author: Yosoylatina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights, 2/11 - 2/18. I got the room through Priceline.com, paid $60 a night. The location was great. Olvera Street and Union Station was 4 blocks away. For those of you like me who do not drive, the Red Metro line/Civic Center stop is 5 blocks away. DASH bus stops right on the corner. Little Tokyo Shopping Plaza is a quick 5 minute bus ride away as is Chinatown. MOMA and the Disney Concert Hall are a 10 minute walk away. Staff was great. Upon check-in, I asked if I could get a high floor since I had read online that the hotel has spectacular views. I was originally given a low floor but when I asked at check-in, my room was changed to the 11th Floor, overlooking the Japanese Garden. The garden is a must-see, very beautiful. The business center in the lobby was always accessible with internet access, a printer, a fax machine and a copier. I also found a back entrance to the hotel where there was a Starbucks adjacent to the exit. LA Mall is a few blocks away which has a CVS, a Carls Jr, a Sbarro and some other little stores. The best find was Pit Fire Pizza Company 1 block over on 2nd St towards Broadway. My only gripe is the bed. That bed was the hardest bed I ever slept on. My boyfriend had back problems during our entire stay. The bed was so hard yet the pillows were very soft. It was a strange combo. Other than the bed, we really enjoyed my stay and loved the staff. I travel often and this was the first time I encountered great staff all around from the front desk to the gift shop to the doorman. I don't think I would stay here for more than 2-3 nights because of the bed, though.

Reviews.Title: “I'm From Calif.: Kyoto Grand Hotel And Gardens Calif. "Loved It!!!"”
Reviews.Author: californiahawaiigal
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel earlier then I expected which they didn't have any problems checking me in 2 1/2 early. As I first walked into the lobby it looked great and the art that was all over the lobby was beautiful from top to bottom. The check in was unbelievably quick before I knew it I was headed towards my room. I got a very clean king deluxe room. The colors of the furniture was neutral colors which was nice. The bed was a little on the hard side but it was sleepable. The view from my room faced lots of high sky rises. And the view below was the beautiful view of the Japanese garden that is located on the property. I loved how peaceful the hotel was, I hardly seen anybody around except for the staff. And I thought maybe this is a well kept secret of a wonderful hotel. A must see on the 3rd floor of this hotel is the Japanese Garden as I strolled thru this beautiful garden I felt my stress just fade away completely. I could tell they really kepted up with the gardening and the water looked so clean. The thing I didn't agree on and shouldn't be charged to the hotel guest. Was the charges for parking which was $24.00 a day, which was charged on my bill automatically when I checked in. But I also realized that everywhere in that area and in downtown L.A, parking was charged. The thing that I didn't care for was that from the parking garage I had to walk thru the lobby and past the front desk clerks to get to the elevators to get to my room. But thats my opinion as for my partner she felt safer knowing the front desk clerks can watch whos coming in and out of the hotel. So thats a neigh and a yeah on that subject. The area is a great location to go to every popular attraction in Hollywood and Los Angeles. For restaurants yes there is a couple in the hotel but pricey. And the hotel connects to a mall with restaurants also. But around this area for fast foods restaurants thats open 24 hours its not close by its a quite a bit of a drive. Or in matter of fact any fast food restaurants, there isn't any close by. As for the staff they were very friendly and always greeted me with a hello as I passed by them. I loved my experience at Kyoto Grand Hotel its a must stay hotel and I intend to go back again for a quiet getaway and see to more Hollywood and Los Angeles attractractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: harryleemartin
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Kyoto. Booked it through Priceline, and got a great weekend deal at $60 (3 star downtown). What stands out is the excellent location downtown. We took the train up and literally walked to the hotel from Union Station (about 3 city blocks). But whenever we wanted to get back to the station to take the subway to get around, the free shuttle was there. Made it very convenient for a non-car stay. If you do bring your own car, don't park at the hotel ($30 a night) but instead in the lot across the street on Second Street -- $8 a day and $5 on weekends. The hotel was also a one-block walk to Little Tokyo, which gave us a fun night out. Dined at Suehiro -- great food and only about $10 per person. A small shopping mall is attached to the hotel (via the gardens) and has a large Japanese market. We got some snacks there and even made some ramen in our room with the coffeemaker. Staff members were *more* than polite and kind. Truly, I did not run into *one* staff member who was nothing less than warm and accommodating. The room was standard hotel fare -- neutral and calm decor. The fridge was a welcome feature for snacks and drinks. Yes, the beds were very firm, but I slept well. We had a view of the gardens and far into the distance of downtown. Fast elevators made it easy for me to go for a non-smoking room and just pop downstairs for a cig. Restaurants in the hotel are very expensive ($49 for brunch!), but there were many other possibilities within an easy walk or via the shuttle. I usually stay at the Omni downtown (which is wonderful) but the Kyoto had so much more to do nearby where you could just walk or take the shuttle. I would definitely stay here again --and especially with the great weekend rate I got.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto not-so-grand, but great location”
Reviews.Author: T-Ruckus
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty weak overall. The best thing about the hotel is the location, right in Lil Tokyo. We booked it through hotels.com, which told us that we would get free parking and room upgrade. Upon check-in, the man at the desk told us that the upgraded room was not clean yet and that he would have to find one that was available. We got to our room and it was just the standard room. So we called the desk to ask what type of room we were in. They told us it was a suite, which it clearly wasn't. We checked the website which clearly shows two types of rooms, guest rooms like we had and suites, which have two rooms in them and are much bigger than the guest rooms. I thought it was very shady that they straight lied to us like that, as if we didn't know what a suite looked like. The room itself was alright. The decorations were like a 3-star, but the bed was very hard. i guess the nice way to say this is firm, but it was definitely hard. The tub was plastic and there was mold inside of the shower curtain. The normal self parking is $24/day and valet is more. The internet is $10/day. The garden looked nice, but it's not worth the money to me for barely a 3-star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, firm bed”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyByte
Reviews.Content: We pulled up to the Kyoto at 5 pm on New Year's Eve. The valets and doormen efficiently unloaded our truck full of luggage and computers. However, the front desk was understaffed and we waited over 30 minutes to check in. Even while checking in, the person helping us was forced to answer 2 phone calls. There should have been someone in a back room doing that. Once checked in, we and our luggage quickly made it up to our room. It was a tiny, triangle shaped room, but had a nice sized bathroom, desk, a couple of chairs and mini fridge. The air temp was good (I've found I often have to set the AC to high when first entering a room). Only real problem was that the second mirror outside the bath was missing. This made it a bit challenging to get ready to go out. Our bed was very firm. If you need that, perfect. My wife slept well. Lastly, there was very little sound transmitted from above, below or from either side. All in all, very pleasant. Would have been 5 stars if the check-in was more efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mattress”
Reviews.Author: Fabricio80
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. When i was looking for a Hotel in Los Angeles the first thing that i wanted was a hotel with a firm mattress, and this is what i found there. It looked like new. The room was also very clean. But, I think that they should offer free internet access in the rooms (they only have free acess in the lobby) and also reduce the price of the valet parking. The location is a little far from the main area.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto Hospitality like no other! Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: businessgirl007
Reviews.Content: All of the Staff were so wonderful! The rooms were very nice, Enjoyed everything about my whole experience. Close to Staples Center, and restaurants. I will definitley be staying there again! xo

Reviews.Title: “nickel and dime”
Reviews.Author: motor38
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was Nice. The room was ok. Upon entering you got the slight smell of mustiness, the carpet had small snags in it, and there were no RCA connections on the TV to hook up a DVD player. There were 2 bottles of water on the table with a $5 price tag on each which would be billed to your room if you drank them which I thought was a joke! The Shower was missing some Caulking around the tub and I think they stopped making that pink shower tile back in the 80’s. The electronic keys I had for the room only worked after trying each of them numerous times. Paying $9.95 for internet service per day was ridiculous when you can get it free at all Starbucks and Best Westerns. And the daily self Parking fee of $24 dollars was a joke, even though it is quoted at $22 in the black guest book in the room. And to top everything off upon checking out I assumed the price I was quoted and booked online included all fees, but I was informed it did not include the daily $13 hotel tax which I had to pay. It seems that this hotel is more worried about getting you in the door at a reasonable room rate so they can nickel and dime you into getting a second job not unlike Home depot. In my opinion if they took as much time paying attention to there guests as they do charging you for any and everything, this hotel would be a nicer place to stay. Not a sermon just a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Fifiann
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big fan of LA but my friend wanted to go as part of a touring vacation of California so I bid for a hotel on Priceline. I got the Kyoto for $80 which was less than half the rack rate and represents outstanding value for money. However, I would definitely not want to pay the full rate for this hotel. It is clean and comfortable with attractive restaurants and bars. The rooftop Japanese Garden is very pleasant and it was nice to take a nightcap out there. We had a buffet lunch at the hotel's Azalea hotel which was $13.50 for all you can eat (it's a different theme each day). We also had half price sushi and cheap drinks during the daily Happy Hour at the Genji Bar, which was good value. We were on the 10th floor and could hear a bit of noise from the street - the insulation is clearly not great - so I would recommend getting as high a floor as you can. I actually wish we had not bothered renting a car. The hotel self park is $24 a day and the valet $30. We parked the car in a nearby lot for $8 for 2 days and never took it out. It is such a hassle to drive and so expensive to park in LA, that we took taxis, the metro and buses. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Union Station and despite the popular perception that public transport is terrible in LA, you can get anywhere you want to from there. So, forgoing the rental and getting the airport shuttle ($15 each way) would, in hindsight, have been cheaper and easier. In the immediate area of the hotel we enjoyed the historic Union Station and the Suede bar and revolving rooftop bar at the Westin Bonaventure. If you can get a good rate, I absolutely recommend the Kyoto Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff; great restaurants; loved the gardens.”
Reviews.Author: adeline9
Reviews.Content: Some of the friendliest people at the hotel; the 1000 Crane restaurant has some of the best Japanese food I have ever enjoyed; the gardens were a welcome respite after being in a business meeting all day. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto Grand Hotel failed to honor our confirmed Reservations”
Reviews.Author: Solentuna
Reviews.Content: We had confirmed reservations since June of 2008 for our stay at the Kyoto Grand Hotel; but when we arrived, after a long flight from Florida, at about 4 PM in the afternoon of October 27, 2008 we were turned away from the hotel. They refused to honor our reservations, claiming the hotel was oversold. Instead they sent us to the Wilshire Hotel which would not have been our choice. As a result we do not have a good opinion of the Hotel, and cannot comment on the accommodations because there were none. It was extremely disappointing to be turned away after we had held long standing reservations that had been confirmed twice by the Hotel. We urge travelers to seek out more relaible hosts. I would be happy to share my experience withother travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service and convenient to downtown”
Reviews.Author: reidj1
Reviews.Content: Booked this directly using corporate rate. Rooms were clean and updated. Good for business traveler who is not looking for frills. (the bathroom was tiny and the tub was flimsy fiberglass) We had good service from front desk, concierge, but witnessed other travelers having difficulty getting into their reserved rooms in a timely manner. What we liked best was the proximity to downtown and the ease of getting on and off the highway from the hotel. Would definitely stay here again for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “October 08 stay”
Reviews.Author: gibadiva
Reviews.Content: hotel nice and got a great deal. service wasn't fabulous though. dinner at the azalea room on sunday night was horrid. only 2 staff we could see and they tried hard but took over 3 hours for dinner between waiting to give order to getting salads to getting the less than stellar entrees. came by once and told us the salads were free but they ended up on the bill. then came by with another round of drinks and said they were comped and they were. talked to the restaurant manager when we checked out and he just said he was short staffed that night. offered no apology or compensation relief. staff person at the front desk finally said, we'll look into this and call you. haven't heard anything to date. rest of the stay was lovely. room was nice, large and nicely decorated. location great too for what we wanted. would stay again just not eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Kyoto Grand was a disaster”
Reviews.Author: jgeoff
Reviews.Content: It seemed as if they bent over backwards to do everything the could to ruin our stay. We had a large wedding party and the staff was rude, neglectful, and oblivious to our concerns and needs. I will never stay at this hotel again and would discourage anyone else from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Kyoto was very Grand!”
Reviews.Author: jridg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens. We only stayed one night, but have to say that it was a very pleasant stay. We arrived and were very promptly and professionally greeted. We were also given ome lovely iced green tea as a refreshment as we checked in. We had just come up on the train and were not looking our best - we were dressed VERY casually and I was carrying a large backpack - so we almost looked like a couple of drifters, but we were greeted like honored guests just the same. Bravo! The room was small - yet comfortable and clean. What more can you ask for? The bathroom was very clean - this is one of our most important points as no one likes a nasty bathroom. We walked through the hotel - the gardens are lovely - and it is quite impressive that they have such a lush garden spot on the top of a portion of the hotel. We ate at the Thousand Cranes restaurant - this is a top notch Japanese restaurant. We sat at the sushi bar and had a superb eating experience. The Little Tokyo neighborhood is very nice. The area is clean and we were told it has been recently cleaned up and is an up and coming area. There are tons of neat little restaurant in the area and it is also an easy walk to the new home of the LA Philharmonic! Overall this was a great place to stay in Downtown LA - walking distance from the train station and walking distance to great food and events. It couldn't be easier!

Reviews.Title: “Not great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: knml911
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there. Don't use the parking there, there are public parkings for $8 just next to it. Even if you go out with your car twice, it would still be cheaper to park in the public parking. And meters only run until 6PM which is good enough when you come back from dinner or whatever you were doing. The room was comfortable but not as modern as advertised. And the neighborhood was not great although you can get anywhere from there with a car of course as it is central enough. There is nothing going on downtown LA so why insist to choose a downtown hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: bpicnic
Reviews.Content: The Kyoto Grand was totally overpriced for what is was. The rooms (supposedly recently remodeled) were outdated, especially the bathroom - the sink fixtures barely worked and the bathtub was dirty. Parking was a complete rip-off - we were told it was $24.00 per 24-hr period for self-parking, but upon check out we were charged for 3 days even though we only parked for 2 24-hr periods. The front desk was totally unhelpful and refused to reverse the charge. There are plenty of other hotels in downtown LA that I would try before returning here. I don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THE KYOTO GRAND HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Tempe_AZJulieAnne
Reviews.Content: Everything is overpriced for no apparent reason. $30.00 per day for valet parking. $8.50 for 4 copies in the business center. $74.00 for room service breakfast for 3 people. (bacon was burnt and juice choices were wrong) Average cost for 3 people at any restaurant in the place is $125.00. Website lists shuttle service available - NOT AVAILABLE. In-house literature lists Limo Service available-NOT ON TUESDAY when I needed it. Also, NO AVAILABILITY TO ORDER MOVIES. I left a day early because I asked to speak to the Manager and he never called. This place is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: tatsumotok
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here several times when it was still the New Otani, but this was my visit under the new name/management. The New Otani had been a solid 3-Star hotel, but I had high expectations for this visit, perhaps because of the new name (Kyoto "Grand" Hotel). Maybe because of those high expectations, I was quite disappointed. The hotel lobby is not spectacular, but very nice. Our room, however, was at a 2-Star level. There were numerous stains on the carpet, and the bathroom, in particular, was quite rundown. Of course, it's all about price/value. In that regard, I feel that it was a good deal, based on the $127/night price I got through Orbitz. I would be very disappointed ath the regular price of $190 to $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice with Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Charmqueen
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean room. Our internet connection was spotty - worked sometimes and other times it didn't. Other than that, everything was fine. Walked to nearby restaurants. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare for some balance from within.”
Reviews.Author: ChanaElCentro
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a "too short" overnight stay at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens. I drive to downtown LA from Imperial County for a business meeting. I was semi-tense from the work day and 4 hr drive to get there. It was a welcoming experience. I was greeted with a warm towel to cleanse my hands and a shot of refreshing tea. The staff was so friendly and accommodating to ensure a pleasant experience. The Gardens are beautiful any time of the day or night. The spa services and treatment are highly recommended and reasonable. The menu options from the Kyoto Resturants. Fall asleep to the city lights. I strongly recommend you book your next Los Angeles (Business and Leisure) stay at the Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility at the edge of downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: rafael100
Reviews.Content: After being intrigued by this gem of a hotel back when it was known as the New Otani, I was glad to wind up there recently with a successful Priceline bid. The room was what I expected for a 3-star hotel: perfectly adequate, nothing to go wild over. At registration the desk clerk handed me a cup of iced tea and a warm towel while I was signing in--a nice touch, and a sign of the thoughtful service that was to mark my stay throughout. The lobby's great, and the third-floor garden is a haven. The restaurant A Thousand Cranes is worth checking out. It's pricey, but the Sunday buffet is one of the best meals (and high-end bargains!) I've had in Los Angeles. The location, with a bail bond place practically next door, may be off-putting, but that's because a city detention center is nearby, as is City Hall. Thanks to one or two restaurants open as late as 3 a.m. I've wandered the streets in the area late at night without incident for more than 25 years. If you use public transit, there are many bus lines that go past it. The Civic Center Metro stop is a third of a mile away, and Union Station is just over half a mile away. It's not Beverly Hills, but it's not Blade Runner territory either.

Reviews.Title: “Very Grand and special”
Reviews.Author: Beachkidboy
Reviews.Content: I live in LA without a car. I looked for a hotel near the Metro station and Art Museum I was attending within walking distance. This place was a gem. Three blocks from the Metro station and two blocks from the Japanese American National Museum, right in the heart of LA's Little Tokyo. Formerly the New Otani Hotel, (It still has an Asian/Japanese theme) they have about a 20 story tower complete with everything you need. A lobby bar which also serves food, the weekend bartender Roberto G. makes the best mojito you could ever have and also is so personable he shold have a tv show.. Also a lobby level restaurant (Azealia) for mainly american food. A couple floors up are the main eateries, a fine food venue with a sushi and shashimi area, a place with a lot of beef and asian inspired influences and a mainly nighttime bar with every drink you want, including every type of sake, as well as food items. Hours vary depending on the day but there's always something, including room service if it's that late. Plus you're in the heart of little Tokyo. Yeah it might not feel great at 10 or 11 at night but it's safe! And there's a ton of other places to eat as well as the in-house Starbuck's, but they close early. For the hotel itself, easy and quick check-in and out, very competent staff, I never had a problem go unanswered. The room, I had a basic room, was everything you could expect, windows that open, variable A/C, bathroom toiletries, the tv even includes a few HBO channels. My favorite feature was the authentic Japanese Garden, located on a terrace on the third floor, it is a several acre oasis garden of foliage, streams and a waterfall. In one corner there is a full bar and grill where you can walk-up or order food to your table. Grilled ribs and a cool drink while admiring the LA skyline in the middle of a Japanese Garden, how cool! The hotel's staff was always there, not only for security but to make sure you had no problems. I never had one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience; highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Monica84
Reviews.Content: Spent a delightful 5 days here. Had 2 days of biz in downtown LA and decided to add some time on either side of that. Love the location in Little Tokyo. Staff very helpful and friendly. Housekeeping was lovely and on top of all details. Had excellent experience at hair salon in hotel, and I cannot give high enough reviews for the shiatsu massage. Truly exceptional massage at the health spa facility which is on the hotel property, but a separate entity from hotel. Superlative sushi close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Kyoto ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Krzykty
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its "Garden in the Sky" are beautiful. The room themselves are standard looking but comfortable and clean. I checked out the Garden in the Sky which is their outdoor garden on the third level of the hotel. It is gorgeous and has a great bar in the back where you can buy happy hour drinks, wine and yummy snacks. I ate a big pretzel with jalapeno melted cheese at a cute table by their man-made river. The scenary is serene and also gives you a great skyscraper view of LA. For its price, it is great. I also liked the fact that it offered self-parking, not just valet. I will definitely come back in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Kyoto Grand Hotel and Gardens
HotelInfo.Address: 120 South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA 90012 (Formerly New Otani Hotel and Garden)
